title.narrative: EXTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS

description.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective communication on child rights issues with stakeholders., which contributes to Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The country programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children.

mailing-address.narrative: 1st Floor UN Place(Annex) Matsitama Road P O Box 20678 Gaborone

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective communication on child rights issues withstakeholders.

description.narrative: Advocacy efforts on reimaging the future for every child resulted in a public commitment by four heads of State from Botswana, Namibia, Zambia and Zimbabwe to form a network of presidents for children and young people in SADC region to further young people’s agenda in the region. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:30/12/2021
